description:
We are searching for an experienced Regional Human Resources Manager for our Store Support Center, located at 600 Citadel Drive, Commerce, CA 90040. This is an onsite field position supporting stores within an assigned region. Candidates must be able to travel to various locations within their assigned region.

The Regional Human Resources Manager manages the HR function for assigned stores and/or distribution centers within a geographic region, providing HR consultation for all levels of management including associate relations, performance management, staff planning, recruiting, hiring decisions, training and development.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned or required:
  • Work with supply chain distribution & transportation and/or district & store management on associate relations matters of coaching/counseling, discipline, and terminations.
  • Work closely with district and store management to assess and develop staffing plans, assists with development of internal and external candidate resources, and participates in selection of management candidates. Monitors and reviews turnover with Management to ensure appropriate action is being taken.
  • Identify, develop and facilitate management training programs as needed to meet store operation’s management needs. Works with the store operations and training departments to ensure management training needs are met.
  • Ensure compliance with State and Federal law and Company human resource policies and procedures.
  • Conduct and/or assists in the investigation of complaints of harassment, discrimination, wage and hour violations, hostile work environment etc. and determines and/or recommends appropriate disciplinary action where appropriate.
  • Monitor Human Resource policies/programs to ensure compliance and works closely with the company legal department to safeguard the Company’s legal exposure by ensuring all human resources activities are in compliance with labor laws.
  • Work with corporate human resources to implement company programs and provide support to store management and associates, including but not limited to assisting the training department with the roll out of new training programs, annual appraisal/compensation plans and the annual benefit open enrollment.
  • Research, develop and implement human resource programs in order to support stores operational needs.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

BA/BS or equivalent combination of education/experience and five to seven years directly related Employee/Associate Relations experience is required. Prior experience in the other areas of HR such as; performance management, staff planning, staffing, and training/development is highly desirable.



OTHER QUALIFICATIONS
  • The job may require up to 40% of time spent traveling and some overnight stays.
  • Because of the special access this position will have to company data we are unable to employ individuals who have family members working for the company.
  • Bilingual and able to read, write and speak Spanish proficiently.


COMPENSATION: The salary range for this position is $75,000.00 to $86,000.00. The actual starting pay will be determined by a number of qualifications; including, experience and relevant skills.
